Topic.Title: Full disclosure by Tiernan Ray, Barron's principal tech columnist

Message.Msg: Considering that the Barron's columnists aren't actually out to give opinions/views and are instead simply supposed to report the news, this makes sense. Anyway, I love how obsessed you are with me, and I've enjoyed the love that you're sending my way, especially since I've been gone from the boards for quite some time, but I'm going to have to put you on ignore now for being a rather sad troll. Adios, "moorelawyer".

Topic.Title: Full disclosure by Tiernan Ray, Barron's principal tech columnist

Message.Msg: I actually like both approaches to be honest. If there is full disclosure about their investments pertaining to the article, I think sometimes the best writing comes from someone that has invested time AND money into the company they are discussing. That said, someone without any vested interest can be a little tougher in his criticism to be sure, but I've read some of the SA bloggers who claim to never have any interest or plan to buy any of the stocks they are discussing and they seem to have a more cavalier attitude to writing what is actually true about a company. In other words, they have nothing to lose or gain so they basically write to get a reaction and probably make money or get some other benefit for an increased volume in the comments they generate.

Topic.Title: Full disclosure by Tiernan Ray, Barron's principal tech columnist

Message.Msg: "troll"?? hardly. as I said before, ibey has a unique contribution here: he offers a window into what is happening inside nvda. Right now, Tegra is totally cooked and Jen knows it. But instead of blaming himself for making bad decisions, Jen is on a war path, going after friends and foes alike. And anybody who is not a full brown noser singing "all hail the chairman" from the roof tops is foe. "how do you model the Tegras?" with Nexus 7 refresh out, I model it as fighting to stay above $100M/Q the rest of the year. And that is counting in the very successful 'cheap' Icera radios. In fact, I expect Icera to carry over half of Tegra sales. T4 is totally dead - Transformer, Toshiba, totally toothless wonders, ibey can go ahead count the number of design wins that won't count for naught. We've all been there before. Tegra sales won't lift until T3i phones come out next year. T4 is dead.... so follow the chairman, all hail Logan 'next year'

Topic.Title: Full disclosure by Tiernan Ray, Barron's principal tech columnist

Message.Msg: So are you saying Jen lied to investors that Tega sales will be flat this fiscal year?

Message.Title: Here comes Intel..
Message.Msg: Thu May 30, 2013 6:15pm EDT. SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Samsung Electronics has chosen an Intel Corp processor to power a new version of one of its top-tier Android tablets. how they do this? Apple and Sammie got their own builds. They top for smart phones and tablets, Nvda couldn't crack their monopoly, yet INTC does?

Topic.Title: Full disclosure by Tiernan Ray, Barron's principal tech columnist

Message.Msg: he's got a whole lot more alias than just those two. Me, I don't care, I just a msg by it's content, not the messenger nor the trading position of the messenger, whatever that may be.

there was a real intel/mobile blog on SA from somebody with real world experience - 30 yrs as intel chip designer. Well worth digging out and reading. nvda brings absolutely nothing to the mobile party. nvda is not going to get anywhere in mobile.If they want to make money in mobile, they should shut down Tegra and just rent out their gaphics IPs.

“Samsung wants to secure as many processors as possible at better pricing. That’s why Samsung Electronics has recently been diversifying its procurement channel in processor chips as a strategy to stabilize production yields of its in-house Exynos-branded processors,” he added.
tinyurl/kzggrm9

Intel are doing exactly what I said they would do, pricing their older 32nm Atoms at wafer die price to get marketshare e.g. around $10 and pricing their latest 22nm Atoms at their usual high margins to maintain profit e.g. the first desktop Celeron branded 22nm Atoms have an initial list price of $132. They will keep doing this every year on each process node shrink strangling another ARM vendor or two out of the market along the way. ARM woke up a Giant Gorilla and it is not happy at being disturbed ;-).

Topic.Title: Samsung’s processor chaos affects Mobile divisions processor choice

Message.Msg: blogDOTgsmarenaDOTcom/battery-tests-for-exynos-5-octa-powered-samsung-i9500-galaxy-s4-complete-here-are-the-results/

Yep! Having to sell a lot more units just to try to achieve flat revenue - sadly this is not even possible with the overall PC market shrinking 7%. Under attack at the HPC side from AMD, GRID, VCA and TESLA and having to sell ATOMS & Celerons at half their historical margins. Not good
